problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the ABCDE shape is a combination of a rectangle and an equilateral triangle, the length of the height of the equilateral triangle part of the ABCDE shape is 6 and the perimeter of the BFGA parallelogram is 40, compute the perimeter of the ABCDE shape. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (11034264.23, 6962464.23)
B = (34264.23, 6962464.23)
C = (34264.23, 34264.23)
D = (11034264.23, 34264.23)
E = (17034264.23, 3498364.2300000004)
F = (3112444.2300000004, 15419704.229999999)
G = (14112444.23, 15419704.229999999)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 8))

# Adjust axis limits for better presentation
ax.set_xlim(-4965735.77, 20034264.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965735.77, 20034264.23)

# Draw the lime polygon (A, B, C, D, E)
lime_polygon = patches.Polygon([A, B, C, D, E], closed=True, color="lime", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(lime_polygon)

# Draw the purple polygon (B, F, G, A)
purple_polygon = patches.Polygon([B, F, G, A], closed=True, color="purple", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(purple_polygon)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=0.5, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, A)  # Right angle at B
draw_right_angle(ax, D, C, B)  # Right angle at C

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="bottom")
ax.text(G[0], G[1], "G", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="bottom")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((B[0] + F[0]) / 2, (B[1] + F[1]) / 2, "9", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="center")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The perimeter of the BFGA parallelogram is 40 and the length of its BF side is 9 so the length of the AB side is $\frac{40}{2} - 9 = 20.0 - 9 = 11$. For the ABCDE shape, the length of the AB side of the rectangle is 11 and the length of its other side can be computed based on the height of the equilateral triangle as $\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} * 6 = \frac{1.73}{2} * 6 = 1.16 * 6 = 6.96$. So the ABCDE shape has two rectangle sides with length 11, one rectangle side with length 6.96, and two triangle sides with length 6.96 so its perimeter becomes $2 * 11 + 3 * 6.96 = 22 + 20.88 = 42.88$. Therefore the final answer is 42.88.
